chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)
Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn William Monroe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

miscConds.notes:
Obtain or maintain full-time employment, or must attend technical school and obtain a degree/certificate in a program.
Must continue taking high school classes in the jail and obtain high school diploma while on probation.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 9-13-16.
Pay DNA surcharge.

No possession or consumption of alcohol, controlled subtances, illegal drugs or prescription medication unless prescribed by a Dr. and then only according to Dr.'s orders and as approved by agent.
No contact with the victim or her family or anyone under the age of 18 years old, except in a classroom setting or as approved by agent.

Undergo AODA and any other assessment as determined by agent.
Register with Sex Offender Registry if Atty Schraven does not present information in the next 15 days as to why it may be waived.

timeConds.notes: Huber release if in compliance with the jail rules and regulations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
